name: The Muncher
description:
In the Muncher, based on the sweets product Chewits, the player takes the role of a prehistoric monster on its quest to retrieve its eggs from Japanese explorers.

At the bottom line this plays out as destroying as many houses and attackers as possible to get a high score. The monster has a variety of moves to its disposal, depending on if it is on the ground or currently climbing a building, which includes a limited amount of fireballs. These can be recharged by eating petrol trucks. Another important gameplay mechanics are the above mentioned eggs: if found, they can be brought to waste disposal sites which are abused as breeding grounds. There they basically act as extra lives. When another giant monster is encountered, the screen stops to scroll until it or the player is defeated.

shot.caption: Loading screen.
Title screen.
Level 1 title.
Humanity wasn't prepared for the return of Godzilla emerging again from the depths of the se... (pardon?... not Gozz... ? The Muncher!??. What a heck is that? Hello, hello...?)
A prehistoric Rhedosaurus came ashor... (not Beasty as well?  But if not Gozzi and not The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms what else??? I thought it was a... Hello?)
Hello folks, this is a tutorial specially for you nice people, for a better understanding of what we, the misunderstood Jurassic mates, have to deal with on a daily basis.
My pal just wanted to lay his eggs on a cozy and warming nice nuky spot, and can you imagine their hysteria? Pff
Cinematic frame 1 - preparing to punch the building. (perhaps some gas released too)
Cinematic frame 2 - KABBOOSH!! (earth's trembling + furious Roar echoing to Andromeda)
I think it would be a good time to mention that song abut the roof on fire.
Comics capture - this is the moment the ground (perpendicular to ours) looses itself from our hands.
My eggs, my eggs, they've hidden them from me all this time... (could they hatch minuscule dragons?)
Cinematic frame 3:(silence) (suspense)

Cinematic frame 4:
- Good boy!! That's my chicken brain!! Come over here you stupid fluffy!!!
Cinematic frame 5:- Liberty for everyone! Equal salaries! Descriptions no more! Power to Jurassics! Adburps! Adburps!
Cinematic frame 6:The building collapsed.
- Do you know where I can find good old lads? Like the staff from Escape... (no clue about it)... or from Terror-Daktil 4D?... (never heard before)...
- Hey Kong, I have this idea: How about we reunite the boys after all these years and make a movie called "The Expensives"?
Parachute snack.
The perfect place to hatch one egg... a nuclear reactor! (are you guys sure you didn't confuse the title of the game?)
Nice view, ships sailing, factories spilling their wastes, plastic bottles...

- I swear I was just picking the corn for the pigeons... because nobody here invites me for a snack! I'm gentle as a puppy!
- That's the suspect from the Foreign Affairs department...!
Burning the building. Cockroach infestation.

First moves on tap dance.
- Help me here Sam! Which foot do I start with?
Being shot from behind.

On theatres now:
The Beast from 20,000 Photons

Cinematic frame 7:
(silence)

Cinematic frame 8:
(KABOOOSSHM!!!! This time the sound was so loud that all cars nearby started to trigger their alarms)
Using the tail to destroy the ground floor. Hey! What the heck is a nuclear reactor doing on the roof? It's not safe!
Chopper season.
Quid Pro Quo. Never heard of it? Go watch The Silence of the Lamps
(lunch time) Isn't it more artistic now?
Yes, yes, the itching is just a tinny bitty bellow.

(ending of a joke, people laughing out loud)
- Did I tell you guys that one about my grandson crossing the road? (prolonged silence)
Hello again folks, let me introduce you nice people my dear beloved future wife! We just met on Area 51.

(this is so Elzie Crisler Segar - love the effect)
Matrimonial affairs: 
- But I did wash th...

(Eye Of The Tiger song)
PUZZOWW POW PEROW!!Don't miss the next chapter of "Munser: the tap gangster". This December next to you!!(fading claps and laughs)
